dcterms:creator: J. R. Kwapisz
G. M. Weiss
S. A. Moore
dcterms:description: The dataset was collected from 29 participants using mobile phones equipped with triaxial accelerometers placed in their pants pockets. The data was sampled at a frequency of 20 Hz. Participants engaged in six activities on a daily basis: walking, strolling, ascending stairs, descending stairs, standing still, and standing. To address missing values in the dataset, the mean of the corresponding column was used for filling them.
dcterms:title: WISDM Dataset

dcterms:creator: A. Reiss
D. Stricker
dcterms:description: The dataset consists of data collected from nine participants who wore IMUs on their chest, hand, and ankle. These IMUs collected information on acceleration, angular velocity, and magnetic sensors. Each participant was instructed to complete 12 mandatory activities such as lying down, standing, going up and down stairs, as well as 6 optional activities like watching TV, driving, and playing ball.
dcterms:title: PAMAP2 Dataset

dcterms:creator: D. Micucci
M. Mobilio
P. Napoletano
dcterms:description: The dataset was collected by researchers at the University of Milan-Bicocca. Thirty volunteers, ranging in age from 18 to 60 years old, were equipped with Bosch BMA220 sensors on their Samsung mobile phones. The phones were placed in both the participantsâ€™ left and right pockets, resulting in a total of 11,771 activities recorded. The dataset comprises 17 categories of activities, categorized into two coarse-grained groups: 9 activities of daily living (ADL) and 8 falling behaviors.
dcterms:title: UNIMIB SHAR Dataset
